title: The FTX Criminal Trial
description: A quick win: understand The FTX Criminal Trial.

hook.text: Sam Bankman-Fried, once crypto's golden boy, was convicted of fraud for stealing $8 billion in customer funds from FTX.

buildup.text: FTX was the third-largest crypto exchange. Bankman-Fried used customer deposits to fund risky bets through Alameda Research.

discovery.text: The trial revealed staggering mismanagement: no accounting department, commingled funds, and billions in hidden losses.

twist.text: Bankman-Fried had donated millions to politicians and charmed regulators. His public image as a responsible leader was a facade.

climax.text: He was sentenced to 25 years in prison. The case became crypto's Enron â€” a watershed moment for accountability.

punchline.text: Crypto's most famous CEO. Twenty-five years behind bars.

quiz.question: What was Sam Bankman-Fried convicted of?
options: Fraud for stealing $8 billion in customer funds from FTX
